TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Scene extends Urho.Node

Docs.summary: Root scene node, represents the whole scene.

remarks.para: In general, you will want to add an Octree component to your scene, without it, none of the visual components will be shown. Â The default Octree component volume goes from (-1000,-1000,-1000) to (1000,1000,1000) in world coordinates.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.param: Pointer to the raw unmanaged Urho object.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of Scene, given a raw pointer to an unmanaged object

remarks.para: This creates a new managed wrapper for the type using the raw pointer to an unmanaged object.
Objects that are created in this fashion get registered with the UrhoSharp runtime.
This is intended to be used by the UrhoSharp runtime, and is not intended to be used by users.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Urho.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: The context that this object will be attached to.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of Scene that is attached to an execution context.

remarks.para: This creates an instance of Scene attached to the specified execution context.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Empty constructor, chain to this constructor when you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.

remarks.para: This constructor should be invoked by your code if you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.
This essentially circumvents the default path that creates a new object and sets the handle and does not call RegisterObject on the target, you must do this on your own constructor.
You would typically chain to this constructor from your own, and then set the handle to the unmanaged object from your code, and then register your object.
